title: Manchester City stars David Silva and Gabriel Jesus take on shooting challenge with a twist - and OBLITERATE a drone
text:

Shooting practise is a vital part of any football training session. 
But we can imagine firing balls at a goal all day can get a little boring, especially when you're David Silva and Gabriel Jesus and finding the back of the net is pretty easy. 
So how do you ensure your trade remains exciting? Well you bring a drone in, of course, and use it as a target, obviously. 
In the above Adidas Gameday Plus Episode 10 video, which was apparently filmed before Jesus picked up an injury, the talented Manchester City duo go head-to-head in a brilliantly unique shooting challenge. Gabriel Jesus and David Silva showcase their skill (Photo: Adidas Football / Youtube) "You'll never hit me" (Photo: Adidas Football / Youtube) 
Taking place in a warehouse, the pair wait for a drone operator to fly the little robot around in the air above them. 
They then take it in turns to fire balls at it - yes, to well and truly destroy the pretty expensive piece of kit. Silva picks out the drone with a long-range shot (Photo: Adidas Football / Youtube) And that was the end of that (Photo: Adidas Football / Youtube) 
Silva strikes lucky, smashing the drone to smithereens... and well, that's the end of that game! Fun while it lasted, eh? 
After destroying the drone the pair then have a brief game of trying to shoot down clay pigeons, which proves to be very difficult given how fast they move.
